summary.p: [Hans Wilpert] Zoller lacks the time to write to Bullinger or his mother [Agnes, née Schmid]. Haller occasionally gives him advice in letters on how he should behave. A few days ago, [Sebastian] Schertlin [von Burtenbach] was in Augsburg and praised Zoller highly. Haller then advised him [in a letter] to remain humble and modest despite [Schertlin's] praise.
- Allegedly, food is not expensive in [Zürich]. In [Augsburg], prices have even dropped by more than half.

div.p: Greetings. If Zoller does not write to you or your mother, forgive him. He does not have the time. I write to him from time to time and advise him on how he should conduct himself.

Schertlin praises him highly, whom I spoke to a few days ago when he was in Augsburg for that purpose. However, I advise him not to be carried away by the praise of others, but to temper his strength with humility and modesty.
Farewell again. I hear that food is not expensive with you. The same is true with us; the price has dropped by more than half. Praise be to God!
To Mr. Heinrich Bullinger in Zürich, his particularly kind lord and father.
